intro: Dolichos huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén bean, is a climbing legume native to the Andean regions of South America. It produces small, elongated pods that contain edible seeds, which are often used in local cuisines. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sunlight for optimal growth. Dolichos huillensis is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which enriches the soil.
